availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, attorney and farmer. Lee County, Virginia, native. Married to Drucilla Posey Brittain Lyttle. Father of George B. Lyttle, Dale C. Lyttle, Carlo Lyttle, Nancy B. Lyttle, John J. Lyttle, Sally Lyttle, and Lee Lyttle. Attorney in Harlan County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Harlan County in 1850. Farmer in Clay County in 1860. Attorney in Clay County in 1860. Served in the Kentucky Home Guard (U.S.A.) as colonel.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 1, p. 25A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, p. 344.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 89.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, District 32, Precinct 1, p. 154B.
“A Clay County History Timeline,” Clay County Historical Society, https://www.clayfamilies.org/history/ (accessed October 9, 2019).
